        Gets the IBlockState to place
        Overrides:
        getStateForPlacement in class net.minecraft.block.Block
        Parameters:
        world - The world the block is being placed in
        pos - The position the block is being placed at
        facing - The side the block is being placed on
        hitX - The X coordinate of the hit vector
        hitY - The Y coordinate of the hit vector
        hitZ - The Z coordinate of the hit vector
        meta - The metadata of ItemStack as processed by Item.getMetadata(int)
        placer - The entity placing the block
        stack - The stack being used to place this block
        Returns:
        The state to be placed in the world

                            net.minecraft.block.Block blockIn)

      • setPoweredStatusAndUpdateNeighbors

        protected void setPoweredStatusAndUpdateNeighbors(boolean setToTransparent,
                                                  net.minecraft.world.World worldIn,
                                                  net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos,
                                                  net.minecraft.block.state.IBlockState currentBlockPosState,
                                                  int cascadeCount,
                                                  java.util.ArrayList<net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos> cascadedBlockPos,
                                                  boolean setCurrentBlock)
        Sets the powered status and updates the block's neighbor.
        Parameters:
        setToTransparent - Determines if the block should be turned transparent.
        worldIn - The world where the block resides.
        pos - The position of the block.
        currentBlockPosState - The current state of the block at the position.
        cascadeCount - The number of times it has cascaded.
        cascadedBlockPos - The list of cascaded block positions, this is used to determine if this block should be processed again.
        setCurrentBlock - Determines if the current block should be set.
